embed.description:
blu_spark XDA thread for OnePlus 7 Pro: <https://forum.xda-developers.com/oneplus-7-pro/development/kernel-t3944179/>
blu_spark XDA thread for OnePlus 7: <https://forum.xda-developers.com/oneplus-7/development/kernel-t3944855>

You can convert OnePlus 6T sold via T-Mobile to international variant by using rebrand tool present in <#451373145010470912> .
Get your device in EDL mode, launch MsmDownloadTool V4.0_factory_patched.exe , press Start button and wait until process finish (shouldn''t take less than 300 seconds).

Source <https://forum.xda-developers.com/oneplus-6t/how-to/t-mobile-6t-to-international-t3888307>

You can convert OnePlus 7 Pro sold via T-Mobile to international variant by using rebrand tool present in <#451373145010470912> .
Get your device in EDL mode, launch msm tool, uncheck box next to SHA-256 check, press Start button and wait until process finish (shouldn''t take less than 300 seconds).

Source <https://forum.xda-developers.com/oneplus-7-pro/how-to/how-to-convert-tmobile-op7-to-t3935947>

If you have the OnePlus 7 Pro 5G sold via Sprint, you can convert it to 5G EU variant by using same procedure

Source <https://forum.xda-developers.com/t/debrand-conversion-sprint-oneplus-7-pro-5g-to-european-fw.4042583/>

Instructions for flashing fastboot ROMs:

1. Choose to download any version of oos 10 through the links provided below. 

2. Extract contents to a folder in ur PC. 

3. Boot your device into bootloader by pressing PWR + vol up

4. Connect your device to your PC

5. Double click the flashall.bat file in the folder where you extract the fastboot rom package

**OnePlus 6T**
 Forums: https://forum.xda-developers.com/f/oneplus-6t-roms-kernels-recoveries-other-dev.8261/ 
 **OnePlus 6** 
 https://forum.xda-developers.com/f/oneplus-6-roms-kernels-recoveries-other-devel.7613/

**Fast download**: Check out https://www.onepluscommunityserver.com/. Alternative download: <https://www.apkmirror.com/apk/oneplus-ltd/oneplus-diagnostic/>.

**Note:** this app does NOT work on 8-series and Nord devices (battery health is being displayed incorrectly).

To enter in Qualcomm EDL mode, you can use `adb reboot edl` or use any version of blu_spark TWRP based on TWRP 3.3.0 or later by clicking on `Reboot to EDL`. An alternative way is using `reboot edl` command in a rooted terminal emulator on your device. You can also power off your device, wait 10 seconds and maintain volume up and down keys.
If you want to exit EDL mode, maintain power button during at least 10 seconds.
You can use a generic USB-C cable however, OnePlus official cables are preferable

To use ADB and fastboot tools, download them from <https://dl.google.com/android/repository/platform-tools-latest-windows.zip> (source <https://developer.android.com/studio/releases/platform-tools> ) and unzip them. If you wish to add them to your PATH (meaning being able to use them without having to navigate to the folder they''re stored first), search in Start Menu for `Environment variables` and click on `Modify system environment variables`. On the next window click on `Environment variables`. Go to `System variables`, select `Path` and click on `Edit`. Click on `New` and input the location of where you unzipped `platform-tools` folder.
You can send bug reports and suggestions regarding OxygenOS directly to OnePlus by posting on their feedback forum at https://forums.oneplus.com/feedback/

You can use OnePlus Switch <https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.oneplus.backuprestore> to backup and restore your data. Most of applications data will be backed up as 
If you want to avoid data of a specific application to be restored, you can get in `MobileBackup --> App` in `opbackup` folder to delete the .tar file associated to the app (eg: `com.whatsapp.tar` for data of WhatsApp)

Please don't ping people or ask for those active in another channel to jump in whilst waiting for help. You are however allowed to ping helper role if required, more info about it by querying `;faq helper`

**A disclaimer about kernels and modules that require setting SeLinux to *permissive* mode**

Setting SELinux to *permissive* heavily compromises your device's security model. When SELinux is set to *permissive* mode, all access requests a process makes will be granted. If those access requests were against security policies they will not be blocked but only logged, whilst *enforcing* mode blocks and logs access requests which goes against security policies. On Android 10+, this can lead to situations where an app would be able to root your device without you knowing if SeLinux on your device was set to *permissive* mode. **This means that if your device SeLinux state is set to *permissive*, you must not install any apps that you do not fully trust.**

Here is an XDA article that talks about this in further detail while keeping it in layman's terms:
<https://www.xda-developers.com/permissive-selinux-dangers-exploits/>

For the more technically oriented, here is topjohnwu's (Magisk creator and developer) explanation:
<https://www.reddit.com/r/Android/comments/lfye5r/selinux_permissive_romskernels_are_very_bad/gmoi05a/>

Proof of Concept of privilege escalation attacks: 
<https://github.com/vvb2060/Magica>

If you have a persistent white LED while trying to boot your phone and a black screen, it means that your device is stuck in Qualcomm Diagnostics mode.
You can turn off your phone by maintaining power button during at least 10 seconds and then use MSM tool to recover it to a working stateTo use MSM tool, you will need to enter in EDL mode. Information on how to do so can be obtained by sending the command `;faq edl`

You can use readback function of MSM tool to dump your device partitions. They will be stored at the root of your system drive and have .img as file extension. For that, get in EDL mode, open MSM tool, press F8, tick partitions you want to dump, input `oneplus` as password, press `ok` and click on Readback button
Dumped partitions are flashable by fastboot.
Do **NOT** share the following partitions: `dynamic_nvbk.bin`, `static_nvbk.bin`, `misc.bin`, `keystore.bin`, `config.bin`, `devinfo.bin` and `devcfg.mbn` as they contain informations such as your IMEI and your MAC adress (source <https://forum.xda-developers.com/showpost.php?p=78229476&postcount=96> ).

Please refer to Magisk installation instructions available at https://topjohnwu.github.io/Magisk/install.html to root your device.

Note that you will likely want to patch your device boot.img 
For reference purposes, you can unlock your device bootloader by using `fastboot oem unlock`.

If when using msm tool you have the error `Sahara communication failed`, follow this procedure to get rid of it.
Press Stop button in MSM tool interface
Unplug your phone, maintain power button and any volume button to get it out of EDL mode until you feel a vibration.
Wait 15 seconds.
Maintain power button for 10 seconds.
Get back in EDL mode, plug your phone to your computer, click on Enum button and click on Start button

You can use `fastboot getvar current-slot` to know the current bootable slot of your device and `fastboot --set-active=other` to switch of bootable slot.

See <https://source.android.com/devices/tech/ota/ab/ab_implement#kernel-slot-arguments> for more information about the topic.

If you're reading this, stop what you are doing. Please.
The reason why aftersales support of OnePlus use Upgrade Mode in MSM tool during remote assistance sessions rather than SMT mode is that it is meant for factory only as it wipes NV (non volatile) items such as IMEI (source <https://forum.xda-developers.com/showpost.php?p=77937552&postcount=90>)
You will also lose your Widevine L1 certificate.

You can use payload dumper from <https://androidfilehost.com/?fid=818070582850510260> (Windows) or <https://androidfilehost.com/?fid=673956719939837166> (Linux) to extract stock boot.img for your device.
Please refer to <#451373145010470912> to find links to stock firmware you can extract boot.img from.

You can remove any pre-installed system application by using`adb shell pm uninstall -k --user 0 <name of package>` from a computer with ADB installed on it.

Example: `adb shell pm uninstall -k --user 0 com.netflix.mediaclient`

Source <https://www.xda-developers.com/uninstall-carrier-oem-bloatware-without-root-access/>
